channel.title: Oneoffs on Jeff Glass
channel.description: Recent content in Oneoffs on Jeff Glass

item.title: Lighting Control Rack Overhaul
item.description: I tasked myself with overhauling one of the lighting control closets at work.

item.title: KVM Stand
item.description: My work often involves switching between several computers - a laptop, a beefier desktop, an ‘IT Sanctioned’ clean machine with access to the work network, and a temporary line to whatever computer’s on the workbench.

item.title: Virgin Receiver
item.description: One of the earliest homebrew ham radio transceivers I built was a direct-conversion receiver for the 40m band.

item.title: DIN Rail DAC Mount
item.description: One of our retrofit projects at work required using four small DAC boards to converet 0-5V PWM into true 0-10V analog voltage.

item.title: Airflow Passthrough
item.description: The airflow situation is often very stuffy, especially in the summer months.

item.title: Analog Meter Class
item.description: On October 24th 2021, I taught an online streamed class on using Analog meters in electronics projects.

item.title: Estate Sale (Oct '21)
item.description: In October 2021, I attended the estate sale of a recently-passed Ham Radio operator (“silent key”).

item.title: Resistor Organization
item.description: In April 2016, I undertook to properly organize my E12 series resistors in a way that I could actually find the darn resistor I was looking for when I needed it.

item.title: Votive Fence Hooks
item.description: I had very little to do with this one, but just think it’s neat - a friend was hosting a small backyard wedding, and while he had designed a 3D-printed hook to hold votive candles on a fence, his printer was down.

item.title: Ahab's Harpoon
item.description: For a production of Moby Dick, the director wanted Ahab’s harpoon to glow with a heated, unearthly light just before the second intermission.

item.title: AM Highpass Filter
item.description: As I was getting started building amateur radios, I ran into an issue whenever I would go to operate by the lakefront in Chicago.

item.title: G3UUR Crystal Tester
item.description: When one is building a crystal filter for SSB reception in amateur radio, it’s critical to know some of the properties of the crystals one is using.

item.title: Home Radio Station
item.description: As part of my pursuits as a ham radio operator, I set about to install a humble ham radio station in preparation for the Winter of 2021-22.

item.title: Homemade Bacon
item.description: During a summer sabatical, I experimented with making my own bacon.

item.title: Lighting XKeys
item.description: A very popular lighting controller in the theatrical nonprofit world is the ETC Ion, which was my primary controller two lighting jobs ago now.

item.title: Robotics Competition
item.description: In Spring 2016, I had the priveldge to MC a local middle school robotics competition that was part of the VEX Robotics Competition.

item.title: Yorkshire Pudding
item.description: A traditional holiday dessert at my inlaws' is Yorkshire Pudding. A simple egg and flour batter is poured into piping-hot muffin tins filled with melted butted and drippings from the holiday roast, which then rise and pop up into fluffy, delicious, buttery muffin things.
